page.title: 04EAST MOOR FARM
page.content: Access to East Moor Farm is gained by the Ashington to Ellington road. It is owned by the N.C.B but leased to Alcan Farms. The farm was built between 1835 to 1850. The office and cottages were built in 1938 and the grain dryer was built in 1974. In 1976 the farm cottages were modernised. It is a farm roughly 340 acres in size. 16 people live on the farm but only 4 employees live and work on it. East Moor was origionally a dairy farm supplying most of the milk to the area, but these dairy buildings and barns have now been converted and adapted to grain storage. East Moor has a rare building amongst it's many barns,it is a horse gin or gingan which is a circular barn activated by a horse on a pole which turned the big stone grinders for grinding the corn, but now it is a tractor shed.
